laboratory_examinations.findings: All four patients had positive patch test reactions to lichen acid mix and D-usnic acid.
Positive reactions included the natural deodorant, lichen acid mix, D-usnic acid, SpeedStick deodorant, neomycin, bacitracin, propolis, and amidoamine.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: During a follow-up telephone conversation, complete clearing of his dermatitis was reported.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive reactions included the natural deodorant, lichen acid mix, D-usnic acid, Douglas fir, sodium gold thiosulfate, Compositae mix, tea tree oil, lemon butter cuticle cream, lemon oil, colophony, formaldehyde, feverfew, pine, fragrance mix, and leather gloves.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Reported almost complete clearance of hand and axillary dermatitis in a follow-up telephone conversation 2 months later.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive reactions included lichen acid mix, D-usnic acid, lanolin alcohol, formaldehyde, bacitracin, and thimerosal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Skin was free of dermatitis at follow-up.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive reactions included lichen acid mix, D-usnic acid, balsam of Peru, and fragrance mix.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Clearing of the axillary rash experienced after discontinuing use of the natural deodorant.
